description: From French personnifier; equivalent to person +‎ -ify or persona +‎ -ify.

verbs.description: personify (third-person singular simple present personifies, present participle personifying, simple past and past participle personified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be an example of; to have all the attributes of.
examples: Mozart could be said to personify musical genius.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To create a representation of (an abstract quality) in the form of a character or persona.
examples: The writer personified death in the form of the Grim Reaper.
